item.title: Top analyst ‘very concerned’ about Nvidia fueling an AI bubble and a ‘Cisco moment’ like the dotcom crash: ‘We’re a lot closer to the seventh inning than the first or second inning’
item.description: "The guy at the epicenter [is] basically starting to do what all ultimate bad actors do in the final inning," Morgan Stanley's Lisa Shalett tells Fort...

item.title: Deloitte was caught using AI in $290,000 report to help the Australian government crack down on welfare after a researcher flagged hallucinations
item.description: The updates “in no way impact” the report’s findings and recommendations, the Big Four firm said.

item.title: Holiday shopping will look different this year, Adobe predicts: AI-assisted purchasing will jump a staggering 520%
item.description: Adobe anticipates this activity peaking around Thanksgiving, with categories such as toys, electronics, and jewelry seeing the biggest boost from AI s...

item.title: MIT researchers studied 16 million election-related AI responses. They found chatbots are ‘sensitive to steering,’ raising questions about LLMs’ neutrality
item.description: The researchers found that, to varying degrees, the models’ responses tended to be swayed by users sharing demographic information.

item.title: Dizzying deal delirium: How the AI bubble bursts
item.description: At our Yale Chief Executive Leadership Institute CEO Summit in June, we heard similar admonitions from over 150 top CEOs. They've seen this before.
